column4: on Jaunty I am having trouble with mouse devices, clicks are recognised but moving the cursor just isn't happening, not sure what changed to cause the problem. Tried all my backed up xorg confs none of them help, dmesg shows the logitech mouse on USB (and clicks work) hald is running. Anyone got some ideas for trouble shooting?
sudo service dbus restart && sudo service gdm restart
no such luck I lost my keyboard from that too
so was unable to login or do a nice restart
this is a problem that has continued throughout reboots and updates
do a ctrl-alt-del to get to a prompt, then quickly type init 3 to prevent reboot
I can ctrl+alt+bckspc to restart X but none of that helps Ive tried that quite a few times
you have keyboard? , you need a promtp
sudo service dbus start &&$ sudo service hal start &&$ sudo service gdm restart , once again
cool have it back, what can I do to makesure all the correct services are running from boot next time? thanks btw ;)
afaik, I should be fixed by now, by make sure those services are enabled on Service Manager
cheers will do, thanks for the help. Otherwise I will just alias your invokation for next time
